Reviews.Title: “Avoid it!!!”
Reviews.Author: N-Tounsi
Reviews.Content: - Communication before the arrival: friendly at some stage and pushy at other stages to use transfer service without providing information (e.g. cost of transfer, waiting time, type of car, hotel internal or external service etc.). - Transfer from airport to hotel: Clients have to wait for 20min to be picked up. Vehicle is not adequate (Renault Traffic to pick up one person??!!) - Service at arrival: Reception requests transfer to be paid cash before check-in (30 Euro). Pick up a taxi and should not cost you more than 20 Euro! - Service during stay: insufficient room service (low internet speed, constant internet connection error especially at night, absence of Ironing service, room cleaning and bed making is not up to standard, bathroom cleaning is not appropriate), hotel infrastructure needs further attention to acoustic isolation to internal and external noise and elevators are very small so if you have some luggage then consider deliver on two times! - Breakfast service: Serving staff are nice and helpful but food selection is relatively limited. - Communication during checking out: Reception staff do not take responsibility for service their offered clients (e.g. receipts for transfer, ironing service their offered through their external contacts). - Location is Good but there are tens and perhaps hundereds of other hotels in the area, some of which have excellent service such as Rast Hotel (slightly expensive but very relaxing) or Hotel Spectra (if you have limited budget).

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced low/medium quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabit99
Reviews.Content: I'm now staying in this hotel this week. My organization got a group discount and my room costs EUR 75, normal price is EUR 90. Good - location. Average - service, room is small, basic setup, lower end (2 star in my humble view) breakfast. Poor - value for money, no shuttle service, hotel airport pickup is EUR 30 one way. It's cheaper to get a cab EUR 20. If I had a choice, I would have chosen something of better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: bookworm0759
Reviews.Content: The Centrum is situated in the old part of the city among restaurants and shops in a cobble-stoned street near the tram line. We were advised to walk alongside the tram line and it led us to the main tourist sights within minutes. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included and it was adequate. The rooftop restaurant had a good view. The airconditioning worked almost too well and it was quite cold. Our room (triple configuration) was long and narrow and the beds took up most of the available space. The bathroom basin was small with insufficient space for personal belongings such as toiletries. But these were minor inconveniences and we would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for that money. Recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: peljo
Reviews.Content: Whereas there are a lot of Istanbul's hotels advertised on the Internet as a great and luxury places to stay, which are totally different in reality (or they don't even exists), this hotel is really great surprise when you take in account money you should pay for it. Hotel is clean and comfortable, supported with politely staff ready to help and provide you with useful advises and information. You shouldn't expect some special view from rooms, but the restaurant on the roof gives you a beautiful view on the entire Istanbul. Food is also great (with regard to breakfast, cause I paid only for B/B) There is only one PC in the hotel (this is disadventages), with not to fast internet connections, so you often have to wait for your turn to use it. Location is the best thing about this hotel. It is placed in the Sirkeci district, very close to the Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Kapali market (5 minutes walking distance), tram station (lines to to: Taxim-Ortakoy cami-Fenerbahce and so on, or lines to Sultanahmet-Topkapi-Kapali-metro). Hotel is also very close to train stations. The location is in the old district of Istanbul, so you have to be careful and to take account on the tourist hunters. Of course, you shouldnt be afraid of it, because everywhere in the old part of city, there is a lot of tourist as well as lot of people selling some things, asking for tip etc. Hotel has couple of facilities. There are a sauna, turkey bath, massage and a small pool devoted to sauna and turkey bath program. It doesnt looks modern and exclusive but you should visit. Environment and appearance of the hotel are not promising anything special. Street where the hotel is placed looks dark and narrow, but its safe. Nevertheless, I like this hotel. If I paid it more than I did, probably I wouldnt be to much satisfied. From this point of view, it is not anything spectacular but good for that money.

Reviews.Title: “complaints responded to next morning”
Reviews.Author: vickiShellharbour
Reviews.Content: We booked our accommodation for 3 nights through Hassle FreeTravel agency in Canakkale. We arrived at the hotel 1.30am after a very uncomfortable bus journey from Gallipoli. We were expecting a room that the agent had shown us on his computer. We opened the door to 1A, an L Shape hallway (arms length wide) with twin beds and ensuite. It was so pokey. After much complaining the night clerk assured us there was nothing else available but Suzie the receptionist might be able to give us something better the next day. I can't help thinking this is a common practice in this hotel. Beware! She did find us a better room the next morning. The hotel was tainted by our first experience. The positive are its location. Breakfasts were 3/10

Reviews.Title: “Great city, shame about the Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: spoon41
Reviews.Content: An amazing city with plenty to see, but unfortunately the trip will be remembered for the awful Hotel staff. Bad mannered, rude and generally unhelpful. I can't wait to visit Istanbul again but will not stay in the Centrum if its the last place on Earth.

Reviews.Title: “Average sums it up!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi1145
Reviews.Content: We arrived late night after a long day touring around 10pm and our one night stay had been arranged by a tour company. We are not people who would usually complain about an establishment generally speaking we're flexible and easy going but staff at this hotel were down right rude. As we approached the front desk we could see a disgruntled look on one mans face and his attitude matched it. They didn't even want us there, if it hadn't been so late we would have gone somewhere else. He was snappy, un-helpful and generally rude. As for the rooms they were basic but we could hear the people in the room next door quite clearly and the beds were uncomfortable. Breakfast was about the only thing this hotel had going for it, would not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: barbaraanne56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Centrum for 4 nights in May 2011. We had booked our accommodation on the Internet directly with the Hotel for â‚¬100 per night, including breakfast,t and paid one nights deposit. A day or two before we were due to arrive, I sent a confirmation email and was quoted a room price of â‚¬82 per night, also including breakfast. Not sure if the Hotel had a record of my initial booking or had misunderstood my email. Naturally, though we took this and after having checked in, was extremely happy with the hotel. Susann, the receptionist, is very helpful and friendly. She was also the person that I had been emailing initially. She has very good English, but sometimes it can be difficult to get the message across. The hotel is in a very central location, within a pedestrian area surrounded by great restaurants and within easy walking distance to the bosphorus, spice market, grand bazaar, Topkapi Palace, and the wonderful mosques that everyone wants to see, making it very easy for independent travel. Also within easy walking distance to a tram stop. The hotel is very clean and our room, including ensuite, was very comfortable. A lift services all levels and wi-fi was free of charge and available in our room and lobby Breakfast is served on the top floor of the hotel and the cost was included in the room tariff. It was fairly basic but there was plenty to suit anyone. The view however was wonderful. It overlooks the rooftops to the Bosphorus. The hotel arranged a mini bus transfer to the airport for us together with some laundry and we thought both good value. We intend to return to Istanbul and when we do, will definitely stay here

Reviews.Title: “It's alright.”
Reviews.Author: jules0010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only two nights before heading on a tour of Turkey. This is a 2-3 star hotel. There is nothing really wrong with this hotel. The rooms are small, but clean. The service is okay, not spectacular. The breakfast was better than a lot of the other hotels I stayed at in Turkey. The location, however, is fantastic! Overall - not a memorable experience, but a lot of travellers are only looking for somewhere to crash at night. If that's all you are looking for, then this hotel will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: last_romeo
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 week in the Hotel Centrum Ä°stanbul . Ä±t was a very pleasant stay . Beautiful and very clean room .The staf was very helpful and friendly The hotel has an exellent locations on a next visit will definitly choose again HOTEL CENTRUM Ä°STANBUL. :)

Reviews.Title: “good and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: baum1974
Reviews.Content: great hotel , good staff ,everytime smille receptions you can ask everythink about the Ä°stanbul they will give the more informations thanks hotel centrum staff ...I will visit again this hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tsrowa
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very happy with this hotel. The staff was not overly helpful, but never rude. The air conditioning only worked sporadically which would have been a huge problem in the heat of the summer. We opened the window at night and were fine. The room size was adequate, and the bathroom bigger than other places we stayed. No tub, but the shower was great. The room and common areas were always clean - there is a pleasant lobby. The breakfast room is large and has a great view. Food was plentiful, but not wonderful. I was unable to use the WiFi in the room, but my brother managed to use it in his across the hall. There is a computer in the lobby available at no charge. For the price and location we thought this hotel gave excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: kiwikirst
Reviews.Content: This hotel will charge you for everything regardless of whether you have used it and their service is appalling with there very unhelpful and unfriendly staff. I was staying with a bunch of friends and they tried to charged all 7 rooms for items in the minibar that were not even consumed. After trying to discuss this calmly and rationally with the staff I had to threaten to check the room myself before they conceded that I hadn't taken the item in question. This may seem petty but you have to bear in mind that one entering the bathroom I lifted the toilet seat and it broke and they charged me for it. I didn't slam it open, I opened it as you normally would and it broke. They charged me 75 lira which is approximately Â£35. The woman on reception told us that one for her house would be 140 lira, and when we asked to speak to the Manager we were refused. The lift was broken on the two nights we were there also so we had to take our own bags from the ground floor to the 5th floor. Also as soon as you leave the hotel there are two restaurants where the staff will hassle you to go to their restaurant - they are much worse and the other restaurants across Turkey. I was in Turkey for 2 weeks, and this was by far the most expensive hotel with the very worse experience.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: fione
Reviews.Content: We were rather disappointed with the unfriendly service at the reception. The room was rather small for a boutique hotel. Would not recommend to other friends. The most uncomfortable stay ever. There wasn't even a tissue box in the room and toilet. Room was quite dusty.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Anth0nyG
Reviews.Content: Hotel Centrum is in Sirkeci, in easy walking/tram distance from Istanbul's most important sights, restaurants all around. Nice lobby, rooms were quite small, but beds comfortable and GREAT air conditioning. Breakfast on the terrace with water view was nice. Terrific value BUT the price you can get via booking.com is much better than what you can get from the hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “Such a friendly place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: deniseHampshire
Reviews.Content: The Centrum is perfectly located for wandering around all the best sites in the old town of Istanbul but despite that it is great value for money. Rooms are fine - good showers not baths - and the breakfast was great especially with the lovely view over the roof tops to the Bosphorus or the dome of Hagia Sophia. There is some noise at night but the double glazing is good. The staff are all so friendly and pleasant and most speak good English and are very willing to advise if you needt any help

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for my firs visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aleteles
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a fantastic city, is now in my top 2 of most fantastic cities in the world with NY. The Centrum Hotel is a average hotel, small, It is located on a quiet side street, with many restaurants. Is about 500m from the main sites in Sultanhamet Neigborhood, like Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Breakfast is ok, orange juice is extra paid, but they provide tea, cofee and milk, diferent breads, eggs, and a traditional turkish food. At night the restaurant have a very nice view to the Galata Bridge, but during the day the view is no good...we can see only old roofs. Rooms are very small, bathroom ok, but a little bit old but the shower work very nice. The biggest complaint was the noise. The hotel is near many restaurants and turkish pubs (so cute with lots of cushions and sofas outdoor...i spent lot of time there). So, this pubs and restaurants are noisy till 2, 3am...considering that many mosques near the hotel weake up the city about 6am...you can imagine. But i think in my next trip to Istanbul i would stay again in this hotel...is simple, cheap and very familiar Like most hotels in Turkey, the internet is free in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just A Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2009naim
Reviews.Content: The rooms were tiny, they were clean to a reasonable standard, carpet was completely worn out. The service appalling, free transfer from hotel to airport offered but no one turned up!! Location is great, but this is never a four star.there are many better hotels nearby, like golden horn or orient express.

Reviews.Title: “great location in heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: patty74
Reviews.Content: The hotel arranged airport transport for us at a reasonable rate but on returning from N. Cyprus a week later found that there is a fantastic bus service between Aturturk and Sabaha Gocken for less than Â£20 for 2 you just have to change at Tachsim Sq. The hotel staff especially Suzan are really helpful in arranging trips for you . Although room was looking a bit tired the cleanliness more than made up for it. The location is ideal with bars and restaurants right on the doorstep on the cobbled narrow roads. thought noise maybe a problem but double glazing blocked any out. and aic cond was brilliant.The main places of interest are within easy reach . Breakfast was very good and they even provided an early morning 6am one for us as we had to catch a flight. Overall would definitely recommend this hotel to get a lovely taste of Istanbul instead of the normal tourist hotel,.There is a lot of renovation work going on involving the old buildings but nowhere was closed . This is because Istanbul is the next cultural city of excellence after our turn with Liverpool.So recommend you go sooner rather than later as the place will be packed next year no doubt raising prices.Eating out was good and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff - I would return”
Reviews.Author: SMartyn
Reviews.Content: The Centrum seems to have mixed reviews, so I was a bit apprehensive, but I can honestly say that I would happily return. It was ideally placed on a very quiet street just a few minutes walk from all the places you will want to see in Istanbul. Although we chose to walk everywhere, we could have used Istanbul's tram system which is clean and efficient and very close to the hotel. The rooms varied; ours was fine, a good size with a tiny but modern and spotless en suite. A friend's room was small and dark, but there was no problem when she asked to be moved, so if you don't like your room do ask. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We didn't have an evening meal at the hotel, as Istanbul has so many fantastic and affordable restaurants, but the breakfast, although described as continental, had a huge variety of dishes, hot and cold, and we could return to buffet as often as we wanted. So.....the Centrum isn't top end luxury; it's a good, honest hotel in a great location with friendly and helpful staff. Don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “It is good”
Reviews.Author: animus
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Istanbul, where I have stayed in hotel Centrum. It is a small hotel in the center of old part of Istanbul, named Sultanahmet. It is close to the most interesting places as Agia Sophia is, and the others like Blue Mosque, Kapalicharsi, Aksaray, Topkapi...Taxim square is just 4-5 tramway stations far from the hotel. Hotel rooms are not as big as they seemed on website, but they are quite clean, tidy, and quitly. People who work there are very kind and helpfull, ask them whatever you are interested in. Bathrooms are good, most of all they are clean, but no comfort to much. Anyway they are not too tight. Hotel's food is very good, and you can chose a different kind of products offered for breakfast. Sauna and massage are available for reasonable price. For the money you have to pay for this hotel, you will have good services.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the crappiest hotel ive ever stayed in. It literally smelled like someone has died in the room right before i got there. They must have just moved the body. The walls were so thin i couldnt sleep because i could domestic abuse in the room next to me. And the hotel staff treated me like i was some kind of ugly dog, when i asked for help and directions, they just shrugged and said they didnt know. The price was 55 euros a night and i would not have paid more then 5 for that hotel. I recommend people stay away from that hotel as much as possible!|

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: themaddog74
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Centrum in Istanbul this week. Our room was generally clean, but the shower needed a really good soak in bleach to remove the mould on it. In general the room was nice and beds were very comfortable. One of the biggest advantages of this hotel is it is close to everything - Blue Mosque - 5 - 10 mins, Bazar - 10 - 15 mins, Harbour where the local ferries leave from - 5 - 10 mins. There are plenty of things to do near the hotel as well as places to eat and drink - well.... if you plan on drinking in Istanbul, then you'll need alot of money. The hotel has free but slow internet and there is a nice longe area in the lobby, but in summer, it's too hot to sit there for long. The hotel also has a Hamam (Turkish Sauna) which is reasonably priced, but as usual with Turkish people, prices have been written in euros to give a false impression. Breakfast is a good service and the variety is good. Breakfast staff are really nice people. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes and the prices are reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but cheap”
Reviews.Author: markfranks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a wedding party and got a group deal of 19 euros per person per night for a double room, which seems cheap to me (not having examined Istanbul hotel prices in detail). So maybe as a budget hotel this represents good value, but there were some issues. First the good points - nice reception and bar (though we didn't use it). The hotel was in a good location close to the historical centre. Although the hotel is in a slightly run-down area it felt safe and there are various bars and restaurants nearby. On the minus side, the room and bathroom were shabby and in need of refurbishment. The room was quite small. When we asked for an extra pillow (only one each was provided) they didn't have one. Neither the shower nor the sink drained properly. It was probably reasonably clean but, due to the shabbiness, it never felt that clean. Its not a four star hotel but, to be fair, I've not seen it claiming to be. If you're on a tight budget, this isn't the worst place. If you can afford more it might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Never a Four Star!”
Reviews.Author: FLYNNY
Reviews.Content: The hotel was rated a four star but didnt really live up to its billing. Its location was in a great place in the heart of Istanbuls attractions but was difficult to find and not very accessible to get to from the airport. We caught a taxi but seemed to involve half the city around the area in showing the driver directions to how to actually get near to it. The staff at the hotel werent very helpful apart from a couple of exceptions and it was hard work trying to get any information or assistance out of them at times. In some there ways there was a slight resemblence to Fawlty Towers in the way it was run almost as if they were not used to tourists. We were told breakfast was from 7 until 10 but didnt realise we would get a phone call at 7 prompt every morning for us to wake up. You could here the phones in the other rooms nearby also ringing at 7. The food was fine at breakfast with a nice continental breakfast but the staff were a bit over the top sometimes cleaning the cutting board with a dust buster when you were still cutting your bread! On our first day we were given a card to slot into your door to enable you to get into your room. We presumed this would be for the duration of our stay. However, for the first couple of days we walked right past reception and they just smiled at us while we went into the lift (Which didnt always work!) to the fourth floor and found out the card didnt work once input. We would then take it back and they would enable it for us again. This happened for three days until we realised we had to do this every day. We had no information in our room as to any rules or what was available. The cleaners were prompt, actually very prompt! They would sometimes leave their cleaning cloth in the room and even found the top sheet disappearing one day and pushed under the bed! on the plus side if you needed a wake up call apart from 7 o clock they were good at doing that for you and the porter seemed pleasant on the first day but didnt really see him again after that. The room was adequate enough with a fridge and a television and also had a modern shower so no qualms there. All in all, it generally seemed to me that they had a lot of work to do to call itself a 4 star particularly with the staff hospitality.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Centrum Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: ibn-i Kemal Caddesi no.28 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34470, Turkey
